reviews.review_msg: Took this course at Ryerson. Lots of reading (which is to be expected). Midterm was straightforward, mainly based on questions from discussion board. Final was case based and was available throughout the semester. Tough marker in re: to essay but was willing to go over drafts + meet with students. Posed lots of interesting ?s throughout semester.

Josh is a great prof.  He always brought up interesting points and new angles to old topics, in an entertaining manner.  Pretty bright and has a sense of humour.  Take something with him, you won't regret it.
He cares about what he is teaching and tries really hard to be a good teacher. Class is interesting and engaging.

Great TA.  He is able to provide difference contexts for the topics handled which makes it more interesting to see how these topics relate to other elements in our lives. He is also super approachable.  Would definitely take a class if he is teaching it.
Just a top notch guy! Always there for help when you need it and is always friendly and accommodating. The class would not have been the same without him.

Super knowledgeable about the course material and communicates it well.  However, sometimes hard to get in contact with.  Meeting with him during office hours will improve you grade.  Offers useful articles/books that are relevant for the assignments.  Overall, a good lecturer but he's one of those that you either love him or hate him.
Excellent TA. Very helpful on assignments and projects as he provides good advice and lots or additional direction!
Josh is a good TA, this course would have been boring without him in the mix, topic discussion was interesting, around if you needed help with anything.
Great TA. Interesting, insightful and engaging.
Clear, easy to follow, very accessible. Made class fun.
